page.title: 03BARTON BROAD
page.content: Barton Broad is one of the largest stretches of open water in Norfolk. It is very difficult to reach because it is surrounded by alder carr and reed beds. The margins are marshy with few footpaths providing access. Much of the fen is privately owned so entry is restricted. A route to the water can be found across the fen from Woodend Staithe. The River Ant flows through the broad, the navigational channel being marked by red and black poles. As the broad is quite shallow the bed of the river has often been dredged. It is feared that the broad may become overgrown with reeds so that it disappears in the same way that Sutton Broad has done. The broad is popular with yachtsmen, canoeists and holidaymakers.
